questions.question: The impedance of a circuit:
options: a. is the AC inductive load
b. is the DC inductive load
c. is the total resistance in an AC circuit
d. is the highest resistance of a rectifier

questions.question: The ratio of true power to apparent power is known as:
In a constant frequency AC supply system, the frequency is determined by:
options: a. the generator drive speed and the number of poles
b. engine drive speed and the power factor

questions.question: The amount of electrical power output for a given generator weight is:
options: a. dependent on the aircrafts power requirements
b. greater for a DC generator
c. greater for an AC generator
d. determined by the size of the aircraft

questions.question: The frequency of a supply is quoted in:
One advantage that AC has over DC is:
options: a. that TRUs are not required
b. that the generators require less cooling
c. that the cables require less insulation
d. the ease with which the voltage can be stepped up or down with almost 100% efficiency

questions.question: The voltage output of an AC generator will rise to a maximum value:
options: a. in one direction, fall to zero and rise in the same direction
b. in one direction and remain there
c. in one direction, fall to zero and rise to a maximum value in the opposite direction

questions.question: If the frequency in an inductive circuit is less than it was designed for, then current consumption will:
In a capacitive circuit, if the frequency increases:
options: c. current flow is unaffected by frequency change

questions.question: The line voltage of a typical aircraft constant frequency paralleled AC system is:
A 400 Hz supply has:
options: a. an output capacity of 400000 watts
c. a frequency of 400 cycles per second
d. a frequency of 400 cycles per minute

questions.question: In an AC circuit which is mainly inductive:
options: b. current and voltage will be in phase
d. the power factor will be negative

questions.question: If the frequency is increased in an inductive circuit:
options: d. the heating effect will increase

questions.question: The RMS value of alternating current is:
options: a. the mean current value for one half cycle
c. equal to the square root of the peak value

questions.question: The number of separate stator windings in an AC generator determines:
options: a. the output voltage of the supply
b. the output frequency of the supply
d. the number of phases present in the supply

questions.question: kVAR is a measure of:
options: a. the resistive load on the alternator
b. the reactive load on the alternator
c. the total load on the alternator

questions.question: The output of an alternator is rated in:
Instruments measuring AC are calibrated in:
Impedance is the:
options: a. vector sum of the resistance and the reactance
b. sum of the resistance and capacitive reactance
c. sum of the capacitive reactance and the inductive reactance
d. sum of the resistance, inductive reactance and the capacitive reactance

questions.question: If an alternator is run at below normal frequency, then:
The power factor is:
When reactance is present in a circuit:
options: a. the power factor will be unity
b. the power factor will be negative
c. the power factor will be greater than unity
d. the power factor will be less than one

questions.question: Generator output frequency is decreased by decreasing the:
The RMS value of AC is:
options: b. the peak value times the power factor
c. the peak value which would provide the same heating effect as DC
d. the value of DC which would provide the same heating effect

questions.question: In a reactive circuit:
options: a. the voltage and current will be out of phase
b. the voltage and current will be in phase opposition
c. the voltage will always be led by the current
d. the voltage and current will be in phase

questions.question: A capacitor consists of two metal plates:
options: b. which have current flowing between them
c. which will not allow a potential difference between them
d. separated by waxed paper or mica

questions.question: In a DC circuit, an inductance:
options: a. never has any effect on the voltage
b. only affects the voltage upon switching on
c. offers opposition to the flow while switching on and off
d. will always increase the voltage

questions.question: The basic unit of inductance is:
In an inductive circuit:
options: c. the voltage is in phase with the current
d. only the RMS values vary
